message.content: Why do the smoke tests take so long?

input.prompt:
I need to find the smoke tests in this Nx Maven plugin project to understand why they take so long. Look for:
1. Test files related to smoke tests (e2e, integration tests)
2. npm scripts that run smoke tests 
3. Any configuration files that define test execution
4. Look for "test:e2e" or similar scripts mentioned in CLAUDE.md

Return the file paths and a brief summary of what each smoke test does and what might make it slow.

message.content:
I need to find the smoke tests in this Nx Maven plugin project to understand why they take so long. Look for:
1. Test files related to smoke tests (e2e, integration tests)
2. npm scripts that run smoke tests 
3. Any configuration files that define test execution
4. Look for "test:e2e" or similar scripts mentioned in CLAUDE.md

Return the file paths and a brief summary of what each smoke test does and what might make it slow.

content.text: I'll help you find the smoke tests in this Nx Maven plugin project and analyze what might be making them slow. Let me start by exploring the project structure and looking for test-related files.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0
         http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
    <artifactId>maven-plugin</artifactId>
    <version>999-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>maven-plugin</packaging>

    <properties>
        <maven.compiler.source>21</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>21</maven.compiler.target>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.version>3.8.8</maven.version>
        <maven-enforcer-plugin.phase>validate</maven-enforcer-plugin.phase>
    </properties>

    <dependencies>
        <!-- Maven Plugin API -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-plugin-api</artifactId>
            <version>${maven.version}</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugin-tools</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-plugin-annotations</artifactId>
            <version>3.9.0</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- Maven Core for MavenSession -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-core</artifactId>
            <version>${maven.version}</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- Maven Project -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-model</artifactId>
            <version>${maven.version}</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- JSON output -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.google.code.gson</groupId>
            <artifactId>gson</artifactId>
            <version>2.10.1</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- Maven Invoker API for batch execution -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven.shared</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-invoker</artifactId>
            <version>3.2.0</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- Test Dependencies -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugin-testing</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-plugin-testing-harness</artifactId>
            <version>3.3.0</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-compat</artifactId>
            <version>${maven.version}</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.13.2</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.11.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>21</source>
                    <target>21</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-plugin-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.9.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <goalPrefix>nx</goalPrefix>
                </configuration>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>default-descriptor</id>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>descriptor</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                    <execution>
                        <id>help-goal</id>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>helpmojo</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-dependency-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.6.1</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>copy-dependencies</id>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>copy-dependencies</goal>
                        </goals>
                        <configuration>
                            <outputDirectory>${project.build.directory}/dependency</outputDirectory>
                            <overWriteReleases>false</overWriteReleases>
                            <overWriteSnapshots>false</overWriteSnapshots>
                            <overWriteIfNewer>true</overWriteIfNewer>
                        </configuration>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
</project>

# Smoke Test Analysis - Performance Issues

## Test Files Found

### Main E2E Smoke Test
**File**: `/home/jason/projects/triage/java/quarkus/e2e-smoke.test.ts`
- **Purpose**: End-to-end integration tests for the Maven plugin
- **Total test cases**: 13 individual tests across 5 test suites
- **Timeout**: 120 seconds (2 minutes) per test

### Maven Plugin Unit Test  
**File**: `/home/jason/projects/triage/java/quarkus/maven-plugin/maven-plugin.test.ts`
- **Purpose**: Unit tests for Maven plugin core functionality
- **Timeout**: 60 seconds per test
- **Expected projects**: 1267 projects in the Quarkus codebase

## Test Execution Configuration

### npm Scripts
- `test:e2e`: `vitest run e2e-smoke.test.ts` - Runs smoke tests once
- `test:e2e:watch`: `vitest watch e2e-smoke.test.ts` - Watches for changes
- `compile-java`: Recompiles Java components before testing

### Vitest Setup
- **Global setup**: `vitest.setup.ts` runs before all tests
- **Test threads**: Max 4 threads, Min 1 thread
- **Environment**: Node.js

## Major Performance Bottlenecks

### 1. Global Setup (vitest.setup.ts)
**What it does**:
- Recompiles entire Java Maven plugin: `mvn install -DskipTests`
- Resets Nx state: `npx nx reset`
- Runs before EVERY test execution

**Why it's slow**:
- Maven compilation processes 1267+ projects in Quarkus codebase
- Full Maven dependency resolution and compilation
- Nx cache invalidation and rebuild

### 2. Project Graph Generation (e2e-smoke.test.ts)
**What it does**:
- Generates project graph: `npx nx graph --file ${sharedGraphFile} --verbose`
- Analyzes all 1267 Maven projects
- Creates dependency relationships between projects

**Why it's slow**:
- Maven workspace analysis of massive Quarkus codebase
- Complex dependency resolution across hundreds of modules
- File I/O for graph serialization

### 3. Graph Consistency Tests
**What it does**:
- Generates project graph 3 times (1 shared + 2 additional for consistency)
- Compares node counts across generations
- Validates deterministic behavior

**Why it's slow**:
- Triple redundancy - same expensive operation repeated
- Each graph generation processes entire workspace

### 4. Maven Process Orchestration
**What it does**:
- Multiple `execSync` calls to Maven and Nx CLI
- Project discovery and analysis through Maven APIs
- Dependency tree resolution

**Why it's slow**:
- Process spawning overhead for each CLI call
- Maven's inherent analysis complexity for large multi-module projects
- No parallelization - sequential execution

## Specific Slow Operations

1. **Maven Install**: ~30-60 seconds for Java compilation
2. **Nx Reset**: ~5-10 seconds for cache clearing  
3. **Graph Generation**: ~60-120 seconds per execution (done 3 times)
4. **Project Analysis**: Processing 1267 projects with complex dependencies

## Optimization Opportunities

1. **Skip redundant Maven compilation** - Only recompile when Java sources change
2. **Cache project graphs** - Reuse graphs when workspace hasn't changed
3. **Parallel graph generation** - Use Nx's built-in parallelization
4. **Reduce consistency checks** - One graph generation may be sufficient
5. **Selective testing** - Don't test entire Quarkus workspace for plugin validation

The tests are fundamentally slow because they're doing real-world validation on a massive Maven workspace (Quarkus with 1267 projects), but the redundant operations could be optimized significantly.

## Main Test Files

**1. `/home/jason/projects/triage/java/quarkus/e2e-smoke.test.ts` (Main E2E Smoke Test)**
- 13 test cases across 5 test suites
- 2-minute timeout per test

**2. `/home/jason/projects/triage/java/quarkus/maven-plugin/maven-plugin.test.ts` (Unit Test)**
- Tests core Maven plugin functionality
- 60-second timeout per test
- Validates discovery of 1267 projects in the Quarkus codebase

**3. `/home/jason/projects/triage/java/quarkus/vitest.setup.ts` (Global Setup)**
- Runs before all tests
- Handles Java compilation and Nx state reset

## Why These Tests Are Slow

### Major Performance Bottlenecks:

**1. Global Setup Process (30-60 seconds)**
- Runs `mvn install -DskipTests` to recompile entire Java Maven plugin
- Executes `npx nx reset` to clear Nx cache
- Happens before every test run

**2. Project Graph Generation (60-120 seconds each, done 3 times)**
- Analyzes all 1267 Maven projects in the Quarkus workspace
- Complex dependency resolution across hundreds of modules
- Generated once for shared use, then 2 more times for consistency testing

**3. Maven Workspace Analysis**
- Processing a massive real-world codebase (Quarkus) with complex dependencies
- Maven API calls for project discovery and dependency resolution
- Sequential processing without parallelization

**4. Redundant Operations**
- Graph consistency test generates the same expensive graph 3 times
- Multiple `execSync` calls with process spawning overhead
- Full workspace analysis for each test scenario

The tests are intentionally comprehensive to validate the plugin works with a real, complex Maven workspace, but they include redundant operations that could be optimized by caching results and reducing unnecessary recompilation.

## Why These Tests Are Slow

### Major Performance Bottlenecks:

**1. Global Setup Process (30-60 seconds)**
- Runs `mvn install -DskipTests` to recompile entire Java Maven plugin
- Executes `npx nx reset` to clear Nx cache
- Happens before every test run

**2. Project Graph Generation (60-120 seconds each, done 3 times)**
- Analyzes all 1267 Maven projects in the Quarkus workspace
- Complex dependency resolution across hundreds of modules
- Generated once for shared use, then 2 more times for consistency testing

**3. Maven Workspace Analysis**
- Processing a massive real-world codebase (Quarkus) with complex dependencies
- Maven API calls for project discovery and dependency resolution
- Sequential processing without parallelization

**4. Redundant Operations**
- Graph consistency test generates the same expensive graph 3 times
- Multiple `execSync` calls with process spawning overhead
- Full workspace analysis for each test scenario

The tests are intentionally comprehensive to validate the plugin works with a real, complex Maven workspace, but they include redundant operations that could be optimized by caching results and reducing unnecessary recompilation.
